CREATE_SIP_ACCOUNT.TITLE: Create computer listener
CREATE_SIP_ACCOUNT.DESCRIPTION:
You can listen to the meetings via the Internet from a computer, tablet or smartphone by installing an app. The sound quality is much better than through the phone network, and there is no phone charges. But it may cost data traffic if you pay for Internet according to consumption (about 75 MB/hour).

Using the form below, create a personal account for each wanting to listen via the Internet. The account must not be shared, because it is linked to the listener's own phone number. The listener needs to call the same phone number with the app, as those listening over the phone network do.

If the listener has lost his personal account information, you must set up the account again below, and a new password will be generated. Accounts are not linked to a particular Kingdom Hall, and are automatically deleted if there have been no calls for a year.

Computer listeners are displayed with a computer icon in the status page:
CREATE_SIP_ACCOUNT.DESCRIPTION_PHONE: This number is displayed at the PC in the Kingdom Hall when the listener calls from his computer.
CREATE_SIP_ACCOUNT.DESCRIPTION_EMAIL: Account information is sent here. Ask the reciever to check the junk mail folder.
CREATE_SIP_ACCOUNT.ALERT_SUCCESS:
The account has now been created with this information:
Name: {{name}}, phone: {{phoneNumber}}.
A link to the account information has been e-mailed to {{email}}.
Ask the reciever to check his junk mail folder.
Did you type something wrong? Then just create the account once more below.
CREATE_SIP_ACCOUNT.ALERT_ERROR: System error! The account was not created. Please try again later.
CREATE_SIP_ACCOUNT.DESCRIPTION_MAILTEXT: Here you may enter a message, but do not enter the receivers phone number here.
CREATE_SIP_ACCOUNT.TITLE_MAILTEXT: Text which is sent to the reciever
CREATE_SIP_ACCOUNT.DEFAULT_MAILTEXT: Here are the information you need to listen to the meetings from your computer. If you need help, please contact the technically responsible. Please click the link below.

CONTACT.TITLE: Technically responsible
CONTACT.SUBTITLE: The technically responsible for the Kingdom Hall
CONTACT.DESCRIPTION:
IMPORTANT! Please check that the information below is correct!

There is only one technically responsible for every Kingdom Hall, no matter how many congregations are using it. He must belong to one of the congreations attending meetings in this Kingdom Hall. If more congregations are using the same Kingdom Hall, they must agree who to assign as technically responsible.

The technically responsible ensures that the Telesal system works reliably locally, and it is him you should contact is case of technical issues locally.

It is important that the information below is correct, so those responsible for the central Telesal system can contact the technical responsible in each Kingdom Hall when necessary.
CONTACT.TITLE_COMMENT: Comments (for local use only - messages to Telesal Support must via e-mail)
CONTACT.ALERT_ERROR: Error! The changes were not saved. Please try again later.

SIP_ACCOUNT_RETRIEVAL.DESCRIPTION:
Dear {{name}}, here you find your personal code. You need it to listen to the meetings via the Internet. Your code is tied to your own phone number {{phoneNumber}}, so you must never give your code to somebody else.

Do not make a note of the code, but copy it directly from this page to the app you will use to listen to the meetings. However, it is ok to save a shortcut to this page; this way you may always find your personal code again.

CLICK HERE - to see how to install and use the app.
SIP_ACCOUNT_RETRIEVAL.TITLE: Your Telesal account
SIP_ACCOUNT_RETRIEVAL.ENTER_PHONE: Type in your phone number here, then click OK
SIP_ACCOUNT_RETRIEVAL.ERROR_MESSAGE: The number was not recognized, maybe you entered a wrong number? If you own another number, please try it instead. Or contact the one who created this account for you, and ask to have the account created again with the correct number.
